text: Take two large bowls. In the first bowl sieve together all purpose flour, semolina, baking powder and baking soda. Keep aside. In the second bowl, beat butter and powdered sugar till the mixture is light and fluffy. Mix in vanilla extract and beat further for 2-3 more  minutes. Gently stir the sieved flour mix into the wet mixture, using your fingers. Mix lightly with your finger tips and the mixture should resemble bread crumbs. You can use milk, drop by drop to make a soft dough. Wrap the soft dough in a plastic/cling wrap. Keep it in the freezer for at least 30 mins (or overnight). Remove the cookie dough at least 15-20 minutes before baking it. Once the dough becomes soft, roll in the chocolate chip cookies and knead it slowly. Make small balls of the cookie dough and flatten them in cookie discs. Preheat the oven to 180 °C (356 °F) and grease a baking tray.  Place the cookie discs 1” apart from each other and also from the sides the tray.  Pierce the upper layer of the cookies with a fork or a knife.  Garnish with more chocolate chips, if required.  Bake for  10 – 12 minutes or until golden brown. How long exactly depends on the thickness of your cookies. Cool them completely on a wire rack. Store them in an airtight container. Finished!
